1. Not as such, although there was an issue with Heritrix builds failing on=

2.6 kernels at some point. Myself, I'm running on Red Hat, but that is
sim=
ply because thats what we use here, not because Heritrix runs better on
it.=
 (Michael, I think there should be a FAQ entry for this question). Just
mak=
e sure you've got Java 1.4.2 or better installed and you should be fine. 
 =

2. Depends on the hardware. Assuming that there are enough active queues
(=
meaning the KB/sec is not limited by politness rules) the crawler is
capabl=
e of (in my experiance) going as high 21.1 Mbits/sec (over a period of
24 h=
ours). Peak loads can be higher, especially if you are downloading a lot
of=
 larger files. If many crawling text documents, bandwidth usage drops,
sinc=
e each text document is subjected to link extraction that takes time.
The t=
hroughput in terms of documents per second for the 24 hour period cited
abo=
ve was approx. 57 docs/sec. (about 5 million docs and 214GB of
uncompressed=
 data in 24 hours).
 
The hardware in question includes dual Xeon processor=
s and 2 gigs worth of
memory (+ abundant disk storage). Heritrix likes proc=
essor power in my
experience, its performance is usually limited by this fa=
ctor although
additional memory can somewhat improve throughput for high en=
d machines.
 
3. Yep, read the User Manual. It has a section on installatio=
n and "A quick
guide to running your first crawl job" which should get you =
up and running
in no time. http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.=
html#tutorial
 
- Kris

red 
to   work with Heritrix. (I mean RedHat 8.0, 9.0 OR Fedora Linux 
etc.=
.)

2. what is the performance analysis of Heritrix in terms of KB/sec.

3.=
 can i Directly start crawling after downloading and configuring 
the packa=
ge.

With Regards,
